cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 55 mi S of the eastern tip of Cuba and 80 mi SE of Guantánamo, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Moving WNW across Cuba tonight–Monday, then expected to enter the southeast Gulf Monday night and curve northwest toward the north-western Gulf Coast (upper Texas / southwest Louisiana) late Wednesday–early Thursday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the TX-LA border (around Port Arthur, TX – Lake Charles, LA area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: No U.S. Gulf coast watches in effect as of Advisory 15A (all watches/warnings confined to Hispaniola, Cuba, Bahamas and Florida Keys).
weather_observation.warning_coast: None for U.S. Gulf Coast yet.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: north-western Gulf Coast from the upper Texas coast eastward across Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (with a chance of strengthening to hurricane-force if Laura intensifies) are possible late Wed night–Thu, with 34-kt probability peaking near 43% and 50-kt near 23%.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Track and intensification suggest 3–6 ft surge possible along the upper Texas coast including Sabine Pass/Port Arthur if center comes ashore near the TX-LA border.
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 4–8 in. of rainfall with locally higher amounts, producing flash-flood threat in the port area Thu–Fri.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Short-fused tornadic squalls in outer rain-bands and prolonged port downtime due to heavy seas and flooding.
